html:
As the 2024 U.S. presidential election fast approaches, endorsements from high-profile billionaires have been pouring in from both sides of the aisle.

Taylor Swift‚Äôs announcement that she will be voting for Vice President Kamala Harris marked another billionaire backing for the Democratic nominee, who currently trails former President Donald Trump in endorsements from the mega-rich. Currently, Harris has the support of almost a dozen billionaires, including familiar names such as hedge fund manager and philanthropist George Soros and investor and television personality Mark Cuban.¬†

Meanwhile, Trump‚Äôs Republican ticket has garnered the support of nearly 20 billionaires ahead of November. Tesla owner Elon Musk is not only backing Trump for president, but he says he is also ready to serve in Trump‚Äôs cabinet. The outspoken X owner is also planning a new government task force, which Trump has said Musk will lead.¬†

While some have merely shared their statements on social media, others have hosted campaign events or let their massive donations speak for themselves.¬†

Fortune compiled a list of all the billionaire endorsements thus far in the 2024 election cycle:

Billionaires who have backed Kamala Harris

Jason Alden‚ÄîBloomberg/Getty Images

George Soros ‚Äì Founder, Soros Fund Management
Soros, known for throwing millions at philanthropic and political causes, immediately supported Harris after President Joe Biden dropped out of the race. His son and heir, Alex Soros, posted about their support in July.¬†

It‚Äôs time for us all to unite around Kamala Harris and beat Donald Trump. She is the best and most qualified candidate we have. Long live the American Dream! üá∫üá∏ üóΩ #Harris2024 pic.twitter.com/KG09YnWHZK

‚Äî Alex Soros (@AlexanderSoros) July 21, 2024

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs time for us all to unite around Kamala Harris and beat Donald Trump,‚Äù the post read. ‚ÄúShe is the best and most qualified candidate we have. Long live the American Dream!‚Äù

According to Bloomberg, Soros‚Äô Democracy PAC has given $10 million to Future Forward PAC and $5.6 million to American Bridge this election cycle.

Simon Dawson‚ÄîBloomberg/Getty Images

Jonathan Gray ‚Äì President, Blackstone
He may have been considered for Trump‚Äôs Treasury Secretary in 2016, but Gray is a major Democratic donor. He supported Hillary Clinton in 2016, donated to multiple Democratic candidates in 2020 and hosted an event for Biden before he dropped out this year.

Despite being known as a Swiftie, Gray announced his support earlier than Swift, reportedly donating to the Harris campaign shortly after she became the presumptive nominee.

John Lamparski‚ÄîGetty Images

Marc Lasry ‚Äì Co-founder, Avenue Capital Group
Earlier this year a person familiar confirmed to Bloomberg that Lasry would be supporting Harris. Lasry reportedly hosted an event for Harris at his New York apartment during the 2020 presidential election cycle and as of July was considering holding another for 2024.

Tom Pennington‚ÄîGetty Images

Mark Cuban ‚Äì Entrepreneur; Former Principal Owner, Dallas Mavericks
Entrepreneur and Shark Tank star Mark Cuban has been very open about his support of Harris on social media, even debating billionaire Trump supporter Elon Musk online.¬†

On the @tim_walz choice, I think people who don‚Äôt like it are missing the lesson of the switch to Harris.

She went from worst to first as people got to know her.

It‚Äôs not a reach to think the same thing will happen with Walz.

People are tired of the ideologues and hate‚Ä¶

‚Äî Mark Cuban (@mcuban) August 6, 2024

Cuban‚Äôs public support has been so strong, some even speculated earlier this summer that Harris might pick Cuban for vice president. He later praised Harris for selecting Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz as her running mate.

Scott Kowalchyk‚ÄîCBS/Getty Images

Melinda French Gates ‚Äì Co-founder, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
Gates is known for her philanthropy as well as her support of Democratic causes, and was quick to support Harris‚Äôs bid for president.

‚ÄúI feel like Kamala, I was happy to endorse,‚Äù French Gates told Stephen Colbert on The Late Show in July. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve worked with her before, she knows what we need in society and she‚Äôs using her voice against those issues already on the campaign trail, and I knew she would.‚Äù

Michael M. Santiago‚ÄîGetty Images

Reed Hastings ‚Äì Co-founder and former CEO, Netflix
The billionaire quickly cut a $7 million check to a super PAC supporting the Harris campaign this year, enthusiastically backing the Democratic nominee after calling for Biden to drop out.¬†

Hastings said earlier in the summer that the U.S. needed ‚Äúa vigorous Democratic leader to beat Trump and keep us safe and prosperous‚Äù and Biden should ‚Äústep aside.‚Äù

David Paul Morris‚ÄîBloomberg/Getty Images

Reid Hoffman ‚Äì Co-founder, LinkedIn; Venture Capitalist
Tech billionaire Reid Hoffman signed onto a letter with fellow venture capitalists, including Cuban, declaring their support for Harris‚Äô White House bid.

That letter called Harris‚Äô election, ‚Äúthe best way to support the continued strength, security and reliability of our democracy and economy.‚Äù

Jerod Harris‚ÄîGetty Images for i.am.angel Foundation

Ron Conway ‚Äì Founder, SV Angel
Conway, a Silicon Valley¬† ‚Äúsuper angel‚Äù and philanthropist, signed the same VCs for Kamala letter as Hoffman and Cuban.¬†

The tech community must come together to defeat Donald Trump and save our democracy by uniting behind Vice President @KamalaHarris as the Democratic nominee for President. I have known Kamala for decades, and she's been a fighter, a leader, and an advocate for the tech ecosystem‚Ä¶

‚Äî Ron Conway (@RonConway) July 22, 2024

He wrote on X that the tech industry must come together to, ‚Äúdefeat Donald Trump and save our democracy.‚Äù He also wrote: ‚ÄúI have known Kamala for decades, and she‚Äôs been a fighter, a leader, and an advocate for the tech ecosystem.‚Äù

David Paul Morris/Bloomberg via Getty Images

Sheryl Sandberg ‚Äì Former COO, Facebook (Meta)
Sandberg has repeatedly spoken out in support of Harris following her entry to the race. In an Instagram post, Sanberg said she was ‚Äúthrilled‚Äù to back Harris.¬†

‚ÄúShe will defend women‚Äôs rights ‚Äî and all Americans‚Äô rights ‚Äî from the Oval Office with a determined, compassionate focus,‚Äù Sandberg said.

Photo By Vaughn Ridley/Sportsfile for Collision via Getty Images

Vinod Khosla ‚Äì Founder, Khosla Ventures; Co-founder, Sun Microsystems
Khosla, a Silicon Valley billionaire, spent over $3 million in 2020 campaigning against Trump and is supporting the Democratic nominee again this year.

Khosla joined the list of over 850 venture capitalists supporting Harris, the same list signed by Cuban, Hoffman, and Conway.¬†

Photo by Kevin Mazur/Getty Images for MTV

Taylor Swift ‚Äì Award-winning singer/songwriter¬†
Swift endorsed Harris after the debate, calling out the use of AI earlier in the election cycle to share a fake video of Swift supporting Trump.¬†

‚ÄúRecently I was made aware that AI of ‚Äòme‚Äô falsely endorsing Donald Trump‚Äôs presidential run was posted to his site. It really conjured up my fears around AI, and the dangers of spreading misinformation,‚Äù Swift wrote in an Instagram post announcing her vote. ‚ÄúIt brought me to the conclusion that I need to be very transparent about my actual plans for this election as a voter.

Billionaires who have backed Donald Trump

Photo by Sylvain Gaboury/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images

Bill Ackman ‚Äì CEO and Founder, Pershing Square Capital
Billionaire hedge fund manager Ackman announced on X that he would be endorsing Trump for president in 2024, writing he hasn‚Äôt ‚Äúlost it‚Äù but made the decision ‚Äúrationally.‚Äù

I am going to formally endorse @realDonaldTrump. I came to this decision some time ago as many @X followers have already understood from my supportive posts of Trump and my criticisms of @POTUS Biden.

The reason why I have not yet formally done so is that I want to explain my‚Ä¶

‚Äî Bill Ackman (@BillAckman) July 14, 2024

‚ÄúI assure you that I have made this decision carefully, rationally, and by relying on as much empirical data as possible,‚Äù he said at the time.¬†

Photo by Drew Angerer/Getty Images

Douglas Leone ‚Äì Former Managing Partner, Sequoia Capital
Leone cited immigration and the growing deficit as key reasons he would be supporting Trump this fall.

I have become increasingly concerned about the general direction of our country, the state of our broken immigration system, the ballooning deficit, and the foreign policy missteps, among other issues. Therefore, I am supporting former President Trump in this coming election.

‚Äî doug leone (@dougleone) June 3, 2024

In a tweet from June, Leone said he‚Äôd grown ‚Äúincreasingly concerned‚Äù about these issues and would be casting his ballot for the former president. He previously donated to Trump‚Äôs 2020 campaign but distanced himself after the Jan. 6, 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol.

Jared Siskin‚ÄîPatrick McMullan/Getty Images

Elon Musk ‚Äì CEO, Tesla and X (formerly Twitter)
Musk officially endorsed Trump in July after an attempted assassination on the former president, sharing his support on X.

‚ÄúI fully endorse President Trump and hope for his rapid recovery,‚Äù Musk posted at the time, adding later the same day: ‚ÄúLast time America had a candidate this tough was Theodore Roosevelt.‚Äù

He has remained an outspoken supporter of Trump‚Äôs campaign, with his America PAC recently launching a series of ads in September warning that ‚ÄúKamala and the crazies,‚Äù will win if you don‚Äôt get out to vote.

Geoffrey Palmer ‚Äì Real Estate Magnate
Real estate billionaire Geoffrey Palmer has reportedly donated more than $3 million to PACs affiliated with the Trump campaign this year. He‚Äôs been major Republican financial supporter for years.¬†

The Beverly Hills resident supported Trump in 2016, threw $500,000 at Mitt Romney‚Äôs 2012 campaign and has donated to multiple Republican campaigns and committees.

Photo by Alex Wong/Getty Images

Harold Hamm ‚Äì Founder, Continental Resources
The billionaire Oklahoma oil tycoon has long brought in millions for Trump‚Äôs campaigns as well as past GOP candidates. Hamm was even an energy adviser to Romney ahead of 2012.¬†

This election cycle, Hamm has donated again to Trump and appeared at his events, helping to rally the oil industry behind the campaign.¬†

Photo by Ricky Carioti/The Washington Post via Getty Images

Isaac Perlmutter ‚Äì Former Chairman and CEO, Marvel Entertainment
It‚Äôs no surprise that Perlmutter, who advised Trump‚Äôs administration, said he‚Äôd be shelling out money for the former president‚Äôs 2024 campaign this year. According to OpenSecrets, he‚Äôs donated $10 million toward the election cycle.¬†

The billionaire, famous for reviving Marvel comics and selling it to Disney, also donated to Trump in 2020.¬†

Photo by Drew Angerer/Getty Images

J. Joe Ricketts ‚Äì Chairman, TD Ameritrade
According to Business Insider, Ricketts and his wife gave more than $20 million to GOP causes in 2020, and are again supporting the party in 2024.

In fact, Ricketts‚Äô son is in politics himself. Former Nebraska Gov. Pete Ricketts was appointed to the U.S. Senate after former Sen. Ben Sasse opted to retire and is expected to be elected to finish the term.

Photo by Sylvain Gaboury/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images

John Catsimatidis ‚Äì Owner, Red Apple Group
Catsimatidis, the head of the real estate group Red Apple and a radio talk show host, has a long history with Trump and has backed him financially in the past.¬†

In an appearance on NPR earlier this year, Catsimatidis argued that Trump is the better candidate for businesses in the U.S. and defended his legacy. He‚Äôs been active this election cycle rallying CEOs to support Trump‚Äôs campaign.¬†

Photo by Rob Kim/Getty Images

John Paulson ‚Äì Hedge Fund Manager
Paulson has been an outspoken Trump supporter leading up to the 2024 election, and is a GOP megadonor. He‚Äôs been especially critical of Harris‚Äô capital gains tax and other economic proposals.

‚ÄúIf they do implement a 25 percent tax on unrealized gains, that would cause mass selling of almost everything ‚Äî stocks, bonds, homes, art. I think it would cause a crash in the markets and a pretty quick recession,‚Äù Paulson predicted recently.¬†

Aaron M. Sprecher/Bloomberg via Getty Images

Kelcy Warren ‚Äì Founder, Energy Transfer
According to Politico, the pipeline mogul has donated $5 million this election cycle to elect former President Trump. He joined a number of oil industry billionaires who have come out in force to support Trump‚Äôs campaign, falling into Trump‚Äôs top 10 donors, according to OpenSecrets.

Hannah Beier/Bloomberg via Getty Images

Linda McMahon ‚Äì Co-founder, World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE)
McMahon has praised Trump as a ‚Äújob creator‚Äù and appeared at the Republican National Convention (RNC) this summer to endorse and support Trump‚Äôs bid for the White House.¬†

Formerly Trump‚Äôs Small Business Administration leader, McMahon donated in 2016 to his first campaign. She has a relationship with Trump going back to 2007, when he appeared on WWE‚Äôs flagship event WrestleMania.¬†¬†

Photo by Paul Morigi/Getty Images

Liz Uihlein ‚Äì Co-founder, Uline
